intro: Saussurea yesoensis var. disetsuensis, commonly known as the Yesso safflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy yellow-orange ray florets. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features include narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a compact, sparsely branched inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
